title: Progressive Weather App
description: A progressive weather app built with JavaScript (Node.js). It works offline, can be installed on any device, and delivers real-time weather updates in a fast, responsive interface.
overview: Developed a progressive weather web app built with JavaScript (Node.js) that provides real-time weather updates with an intuitive interface. The app is fully installable on any device and supports offline access, allowing users to check previously viewed forecasts even without an internet connection.
tasks: Developed the frontend architecture with reusable UI components for fast rendering
Integrated OpenWeather API to fetch live forecasts and weather data
Implemented service workers to enable offline functionality and PWA installation
Optimized user experience (UX) for performance and accessibility across devices
achievements: Improved page speed by 45% through efficient caching and code optimization
Enabled offline access and device installation for a native app-like experience
Enhanced usability with real-time updates and intuitive visual design
challenges: Limited offline functionality when fetching new data
API rate limiting during frequent updates
UI performance drops on slower networks.
solutions: Implemented advanced caching strategies with service workers to store recent forecasts
Added a client-side request scheduler and local data fallback system
Optimized component rendering and reduced bundle size using code splitting.
